hints.content: Start by understanding the operations you can perform on the array. You can remove pairs of elements from the start, end, or both ends. Make sure to visualize how the array changes after each operation.
Consider the score of each operation. The score is the sum of the two elements you remove. Think about how you can keep track of the scores for each operation you perform.
You need to find a way to ensure that all operations have the same score. This means you should be able to compare the scores of different operations. How might you store these scores?
Think about how the operations affect the remaining elements in the array. Each operation reduces the size of the array, so you'll need to manage the indices carefully.
To maximize the number of operations, consider the order in which you perform them. You might want to try different sequences of operations to see if they yield the same score.
Since you can only perform operations while there are at least 2 elements, be mindful of the array's size. What happens when you reach the end of the array or have an odd number of elements?
You can use a frequency map to count how many times each score occurs. This will help you determine how many operations can be performed with the same score.
As you calculate scores, consider edge cases where the array has repeated elements. How might this impact your ability to achieve the same score across multiple operations?
Think about using a loop to simulate the operations, keeping track of the scores in each iteration. You can use a list to store the scores and then analyze the frequency of each score.
Finally, after gathering all possible scores, find the maximum frequency of any score. This will give you the maximum number of operations that can be performed with the same score.

questionNotes: You can perform operations only while the array has at least 2 elements.
The score of an operation is the sum of two removed elements.
You need to maximize the number of operations with the same score.
The input array can have a length between 2 and 2000.
Each element in the array is between 1 and 1000.
